name: Lateral connectivity
functionStatement: Ensures habitat availability and water quality during low water levels, and indicates non-storm conditions experienced the majority of the time.
descriptionMarkdown: Extent to which water remains in contact with both banks and low benches during low flow, sustaining edge habitat and exchange.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Measure wetted width at 5-10 cross sections; estimate percent of bankline with a continuous wetted margin; note connected backwaters/benches; support with dry-season imagery and LiDAR.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Banks largely dry; narrow central thread only.
Criteria: Lateral pockets and benches mostly dry or isolated.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Long dry shelves common; only scattered wetted edges.
Criteria: Most lateral pockets disconnected except during storms.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Banks wetted in many places but intermittent dry shelves.
Criteria: Some benches/backwaters connected while others are dry.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Water contacts both banks along most of the reach; lateral pockets connected.
Criteria: Most margins wetted with few dry shelves; small pockets remain connected.
